      51                 :            :                  * This operator makes the iterator point to the same position but in another raw buffer.
      52                 :            :                  * The new raw buffer is the same than the source iterator's.
      53                 :            :                  * @param iterator The source iterator. The iterator will use the source iterator's raw buffer after this operation.
      54                 :            :                  */

      60                 :            :                         m_currentPosition = m_buffer + diff;
      61                 :            :                     }

      66                 :            :                  * @param The source iterator. The iterator will use the source's iterator index to point to its own raw buffer.

     184                 :            :         /*!

     197                 :            :                  * The user can obtain this internal stream using the function eprosima::fastcdr::FastBuffers::getBuffer(). Be careful because this internal stream
     198                 :            :                  * is deleted in the destruction of the eprosima::fastcdr::FastBuffers object.
     199                 :            :                  */

     203                 :            :                  * @brief This constructor assigns the user's stream of bytes to the eprosima::fastcdr::FastBuffers object.

     206                 :            :                  * @param buffer The user's buffer that will be used. This buffer is not deallocated in the object's destruction. Cannot be NULL.
     207                 :            :                  * @param bufferSize The length of user's buffer.
     208                 :            :                  */
     209                 :            :                 FastBuffer(char* const buffer, const size_t bufferSize);
